intro: Zanthoxylum bonifaziae, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the highlands of central Mexico. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Zanthoxylum bonifaziae is adapted to limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
